dta.TransitLine¶

class TransitLine(net, id, label, litype, vtype, stime, level, active, hway, dep)¶

Bases: object

Transit Line representation for a DTA Network. A Transit Line consists of a set of attributes and a list of TransitSegment instances.

Constructor.

  • net is a Network instance
  • id is an integer ID for the transit line
  • label is a string label
  • litype is a one of TransitLine.LINE_TYPE_BUS or TransitLine.LINE_TYPE_TRAM
  • vtype is a string representing vehicle type (more?)
  • stime is an instance of dta.Time representing the start time of the line
  • level is an indicator for vertical alignment
  • active is one of TransitLine.LINE_ACTIVE or TransitLine.LINE_INACTIVE
  • hway is the line headway in minutes, a float
  • dep is the number of departures, an integer (???)
__init__(net, id, label, litype, vtype, stime, level, active, hway, dep)¶

Constructor.

  • net is a Network instance
  • id is an integer ID for the transit line
  • label is a string label
  • litype is a one of TransitLine.LINE_TYPE_BUS or TransitLine.LINE_TYPE_TRAM
  • vtype is a string representing vehicle type (more?)
  • stime is an instance of dta.Time representing the start time of the line
  • level is an indicator for vertical alignment
  • active is one of TransitLine.LINE_ACTIVE or TransitLine.LINE_INACTIVE
  • hway is the line headway in minutes, a float
  • dep is the number of departures, an integer (???)

Attributes

LINE_ACTIVE int(x[, base]) -> integer
LINE_INACTIVE int(x[, base]) -> integer
LINE_TYPE_BUS int(x[, base]) -> integer
LINE_TYPE_TRAM int(x[, base]) -> integer
id Integer identifier for the transit line.
LINE_ACTIVE = 1¶

If the transit line is active in the simulation, pass this as the active arg of TransitLine.__init__()

LINE_INACTIVE = 0¶

If the transit line is not active in the simulation, pass this as the active arg of TransitLine.__init__()

LINE_TYPE_BUS = 0¶

If the transit line is a bus, pass this as the litype arg of TransitLine.__init__()

LINE_TYPE_TRAM = 1¶

If the transit line is a tram or an LRT, pass this as the litype arg of TransitLine.__init__()

addSegment(link, dwell, label=None, lane=0, stopside=0, position=-1)¶

Create a TransitSegment instance with the given information and add it to this line.

See TransitSegment.__init__() for how most of the arguments are interpreted. Pass -1 for position to append it to the end of this line’s transit segments, otherwise the position will be used for insertion.

checkMovementsAreAllowed(enableMovement)¶

Iterates through the TransitSegment instances for this line, and warns about any two that are adjacent and share a node, but which do not have a Movement between them allowing transit.

If makeUturnsRoundabouts is passed, then U-Turns will be made into roundabouts.

Returns the Dynameq-formatted header string (the start of the file preceding the actual transit line data

Return the number of stops the transit line makes

getSegment(startNodeId=None, endNodeId=None)¶

Return the segment with starting from startNodeId or ending to node with endNodeId.

hasNode(nodeId)¶

Return True if the transit Line visits the node with the given id

hasSegment(startNodeId=None, endNodeId=None)¶

Return True if the line has a segment with the given start or end nodes. Otherwise return false

id¶

Integer identifier for the transit line.

lastSegment()¶

Returns the last segment.

classmethod read(net, fileName)¶

Generator function that yields TransitLine instances read from file specified by fileName. For example:

for transitline in dta.TransitLine.read(network, input_transit_filename):
    print transitline
validatePath()¶
